remixlab.proscene

Interface Trackable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InteractiveAvatarFrame

    public interface Trackable
    Interface for objects that are to be tracked by a proscene Camera when its mode is THIRD_PERSON.

    How does it work ?

    All objects that are to be tracked by the Scene.camera() (known as avatars) should implement this interface. To setup an avatar you should then call Scene.setAvatar(Trackable). The avatar will be tracked by the Scene.camera() when Scene.currentCameraProfile() is an instance of ThirdPersonCameraProfile.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      processing.core.PVector cameraPosition()
      Returns the position of the tracking Camera in the world coordinate system.
      void computeCameraPosition()
      Computes the camera position according to some specific InteractiveFrame parameters which depends on the type of interaction that is to be implemented.
      processing.core.PVector target()
      Returns the target point to be set as the Camera.lookAt(PVector).
      processing.core.PVector upVector()
      Returns the vector to be set as the Camera.upVector().

    • Method Detail

      • cameraPosition

        processing.core.PVector cameraPosition()
        Returns the position of the tracking Camera in the world coordinate system.
        Returns:
        PVector holding the camera position defined in the world coordinate system.

      • upVector

        processing.core.PVector upVector()
        Returns the vector to be set as the Camera.upVector().
        Returns:
        PVector holding the camera up-vector defined in the world coordinate system.

      • target

        processing.core.PVector target()
        Returns the target point to be set as the Camera.lookAt(PVector).
        Returns:
        PVector holding the camera look-at vector defined in the world coordinate system.

      • computeCameraPosition

        void computeCameraPosition()
        Computes the camera position according to some specific InteractiveFrame parameters which depends on the type of interaction that is to be implemented.

        It is responsibility of the object implementing this interface to update the camera position by properly calling this method.
